precedents.title: Eastgate Centre, Harare, Zimbabwe
precedents.description: A shopping centre and office block that uses passive cooling, inspired by the self-cooling mounds of African termites. It uses only 10% of the energy of a conventional building its size.

precedents.title: Makoko Floating School, Lagos, Nigeria
precedents.description: A prototype floating structure, built for the Makoko waterfront community. It uses local materials and is designed to be a scalable solution for coastal communities facing rising sea levels.

precedents.title: Lideta Mercato, Addis Ababa, Ethiopia
precedents.description: A modern marketplace that uses a perforated concrete facade, inspired by traditional Ethiopian fabrics, to provide natural light and ventilation, creating a comfortable shopping environment in a tropical climate.

precedents.title: Umubano Primary School, Kigali, Rwanda
precedents.description: A school built with local labor and materials, featuring earth-brick walls and simple steel trusses. The design focuses on creating comfortable learning environments with limited resources.
